Sketch Saga.title: Sketching
Sketch Saga.overview: Unlock your artistic potential in our Sketching Event! Embrace the joy of creating with strokes of imagination. Join us for a celebration of creativity, where every sketch tells a unique story – participate and let your artistic spirit flourish on our canvas of inspiration!
rules: Only 1 student per class can participate.
Upon completion of registration, kindly note that it will be considered final; no alterations will be accommodated under any circumstances.
Participants have the liberty to sketch anything according to their preference.
A3 Drawing sheets will be provided by the College.
Participants are required to bring their own stationary.
Use of Phone/Internet is strictly prohibited.
No stencils allowed.
Only pencils, black pens, color pencils, and black sketch pens are allowed.
The artist must submit their sketches within a maximum time limit of 90 minutes.
Winners will be given merit certificates, and participants will be getting participation E-certificates.
The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
Some of the best sketches will be displayed at the Art gallery on 2nd February, 2024.

Doodle Derby.title: Doodling Competition
Doodle Derby.overview: Dive into the world of spontaneous creativity with our Doodling Event with a Twist! Unleash your imagination as you add unexpected elements to your doodles. Join us for a uniquely vibrant experience – where every stroke is a surprise and every participant is an artist with a twist!
rules: Upon completion of registration, kindly note that it will be considered final; no alterations will be accommodated under any circumstances.
No wifi services will be provided. Participants are required to make their arrangements for the same.
Time for doodling - 90 Mins.
A3 size white sheets will be provided to all the participants.
Participants must carry their stationary.
Only black-colored sketch pens or markers are allowed.

Judging criteria:
  • Artistic merit.
  • Creativity and originality,
  • Cleanliness in drawing,
  • Communication of content theme in both the drawing and supporting statements
  • Adherence to the rules
Decisions taken by judges/coordinators will be final.
Some of the best sketches will be displayed at the Art gallery on 2nd February, 2024.

Format
  • The theme for the doodle will be revealed to all participants at the beginning of the competition.
  • Teams can collectively decide what they want to draw. Time will be allotted for brainstorming on the theme. (Use of mobile phones will be allowed for 10 mins)
  • Only one person from a team of three students is allowed to doodle at a time.
  • The doodling will commence with the first team member. A whistle will be blown randomly by coordinators signaling the next team member to start doodling.
  • Each team member will take turns doodling during the rotation, with a whistle indicating when to switch to the next participant.
  • TWIST- While one team member is doodling, the other team members must refrain from viewing the ongoing doodle until the whistle blows for the next participant.
